name: EnergyFormatter
desc: A formatter that provides localized descriptions of energy values.

items.name: var isForFoodEnergyUse: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the energy value is used to measure food energy.

items.name: func getObjectValue(AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer<AnyObject?>?, for: String, errorDescription: AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer<NSString?>?) -> Bool
items.desc: This method is not supported for the NSEnergyFormatter class.

items.name: var numberFormatter: NumberFormatter!
items.desc: The number formatter used to format the numbers in energy strings.

items.name: func string(fromJoules: Double) -> String
items.desc: Returns an energy string for the provided value.

items.name: func string(fromValue: Double, unit: EnergyFormatter.Unit) -> String
items.desc: Returns a properly formatted energy string for the given value and unit.

items.name: func unitString(fromJoules: Double, usedUnit: UnsafeMutablePointer<EnergyFormatter.Unit>?) -> String
items.desc: Returns the unit string for the provided value.

items.name: func unitString(fromValue: Double, unit: EnergyFormatter.Unit) -> String
items.desc: Returns the unit string based on the provided value and unit.

items.name: var unitStyle: Formatter.UnitStyle
items.desc: The unit style used by this formatter.

items.name: enum EnergyFormatter.Unit
items.desc: The units supported by the NSEnergyFormatter class.
